info.title: DOTA 2 Steam Web
info.description: A WebAPI for match history is now available on Dota 2. Web developers can now retrieve the match history and match details in JSON or XML format for use in their own applications.

get.description: To retrieve the specific details of a match, use this API:

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Steam account id (this is not SteamID, its only the account number portion)

parameters.name: date_max
parameters.description: date in UTC seconds since Jan 1, 1970 (unix time format)

parameters.name: date_min
parameters.description: date in UTC seconds since Jan 1, 1970 (unix time format)

parameters.name: hero_id
parameters.description: Search for matches with a specific hero being played, hero id's are in dota/scripts/npc/npc_heroes.txt in your Dota install directory

parameters.name: matches_requested
parameters.description: Defaults is 25 matches, this can limit to less

parameters.name: player_name
parameters.description: Search matches with a player name, exact match only

parameters.name: skill
parameters.description: 0 for any, 1 for normal, 2 for high, 3 for very high skill

parameters.name: start_at_match_id
parameters.description: Start the search at the indicated match id, descending

get.description: will return the latest 25 public matches in JSON format. You can request it in XML format

parameters.name: start_at_match_id
parameters.description: To request the next 25, use the param "start_at_match_id" with one less than the last match number you received
